Description:
Idyllic half-moon bays with soft white sand and sparkling
turquoise waters, teeming with marine life and ancient
treasures: Sardinia’s beaches are among the most beautiful in
the world. With over 1,600 km (1,000 miles) of coastline to
uncover, your own slice of paradise is within easy reach.

SubImages.Description:
Cagliari’s famous beach extends for more than 8 km (5 miles), from the
Roman ruintopped promontory of Sella del Diavolo (Devil’s Saddle) to thetown of Margine Rosso on the Quartu Sant’Elena coast.
SubImages.Name: Poetto Beach
